item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 15, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Biological Miracle – Wood Frog (165 points | 43 comments)
2. Why did people rub snow on frozen feet? (7 points | 4 comments)
3. Show HN: Free mortgage analysis tool to avoid getting screwed by closing costs (129 points | 67 comments)
4. C++ Template Macroprogramming versus Lisp Macros (34 points | 11 comments)
5. Seer: A GUI front end to GDB for Linux (254 points | 153 comments)
6. First Impressions: Lenovo T14s with Qualcomm Snapdragon ARM64 CPU (Phk) (18 points | 10 comments)
7. The Practical Guide to Scaling Django (47 points | 3 comments)
8. Maybe Bluesky has "won" (142 points | 243 comments)
9. Show HN: Scooter – Interactive find and replace in the terminal (92 points | 42 comments)
10. The Battle Line at Louvain (107 points | 59 comments)
11. Retrofitting spatial safety to lines of C++ (9 points | 3 comments)
12. Emit-C: A time travelling programming language (30 points | 7 comments)
13. Installed an open source garage door opener, and I'm loving it (48 points | 21 comments)
14. Chimpanzees' performance on computer tasks changes when people watching them (13 points | 6 comments)
15. Surveillance and the history of 19th-century wearable tech (14 points | 5 comments)
16. MomBoard: E-ink display for a parent with amnesia (1806 points | 224 comments)
17. Gliimly is a programming language for web services (25 points | 21 comments)
18. Pex: A tool for generating .pex (Python EXecutable) files, lock files and venvs (54 points | 31 comments)
19. Show HN: OnAir – create link, receive calls (176 points | 82 comments)
20. Show HN: Libretto – Simple recording and editing, an alternative to Descript (14 points | 3 comments)
21. Go-taskflow: A taskflow-like General-purpose Task-parallel Programming Framework (25 points | 2 comments)
22. Incorporation of photosynthetically active algal chloroplasts in mammalian cells (22 points | 10 comments)
23. Tesla has the highest fatal accident rate of all auto brands, study finds (180 points | 197 comments)
24. Something weird is happening with LLMs and chess (622 points | 423 comments)
25. Upcoming Hardening in PHP (301 points | 119 comments)
26. Modern Treasury (YC S18) Is Hiring a Product Designer ( | hide)
27. FBDetect: Catching Tiny Performance Regressions at Hyperscale [pdf] (50 points | 21 comments)
28. Building LawStar – a year long indie hacking journey (48 points | 21 comments)
29. Cyph – A cryptographically secure messaging and social networking service (7 points | 2 comments)
30. Manual for PUB (a markup language in 1971) – Larry Tesler (62 points | 12 comments)
